name: SHAWARMA MOCCI
address: 825 Morris Park Ave, Bronx, NY 10462, USA

reviews.text: The experience was overall overwhelming and the staff were rude when trying to order.

One of the worst place and behavior of service personnel awful ! Would never recommend anyone to this place again.
Bad Behavior
Just I visited this place. The weather is very unprofessional in his more training and he needs to know how to behave with customers

I recently visited Shawarma Mocci, and unfortunately, the experience was far from pleasant. The waiterâ€™s behavior was extremely rude and unprofessional, which completely ruined the visit. Instead of being welcoming and attentive, the staff acted as if they were doing us a favor by serving.
Good food and service should go hand in hand, and no matter how decent the food might be, bad behavior from staff leaves a lasting negative impression. I genuinely hope the management looks into this and trains their staff to treat customers with basic respect and courtesy.
Would not recommend until service improves.

We visited this place, but unfortunately, the person who took our order was extremely rude. We tried to place our order politely, yet his attitude made us feel as if we were asking for free food. On top of that, the food didnâ€™t taste very good either. Really disappointed with both the service and the quality. ğŸ˜¡

No one speaks English well and they cook the food to hell. Iâ€™ve given it 3 tryâ€™s and every time the food is just terrible.
Good
Great food
Disappointed and pricy
Garbage and way too expensive
Food is mediocre and the price is not worth that garbage food.
Best shawarma ever .
Chicken too much burn and so much bitter. Customer service is very poor, they're not friendly.
This place was my first time I visit Sandwich lamb Sharma it was delicious and love their side, yummy sauce
The best shawarma spot ever!!! I used to travel to queens for good food now we have a nice spot in the Bronx! Highly recommended!!

Very good very tasty
Try chicken shawarma itâ€™s really delicious
The service is horrible and the food it's not tasty at all the shawarma quality and flavor is poor this place is a joke .
The best food in the city
The food was yummy. The shawrma and rice was good. I liked the wings and fries too. The restaurant was clean and good. I liked the food and service.

One of the most delicious meals Iâ€™ve had in my life I recommend it to everyone
Food was really good and workers were really nice and helpful I like the vibe it gave off really nice place to be honest

I had the lentils soup, it was a great, very rich flavor, plus i had tawook with salad and hummus plate, it was grilled to perfection and the salad was so fresh. I'm glad I stopped by this clean, place on my visit to the Bronx.
Excellent environment, friendly service, great menu choices and really decent and fire food.

I recently visited Shawarma Mocci, located in the Bronx, and it was a truly commendable experience.
I tried the mixed grill platter, which showcased excellent cooking quality and a perfect balance of flavors the meats were tender and expertly grilled.
I also tasted the seafood salmon dish, which was fresh, carefully cooked, and remarkably flavorful.
The hummus salad was rich in texture, fresh, and authentically delicious.
The service was outstanding, marked by promptness and warm hospitality, reflecting the professionalism and attentiveness of the staff.
The restaurant offers a diverse menu with reasonable prices considering the high quality of the dishes served.
The interior environment is clean and peaceful, making it an ideal spot for families and friends.
It is worth noting that the restaurant is now under new management with a new team, resu
lting in a significant improvement in both service and food quality compared to the situation two months ago.
I highly recommend visiting this restaurant for anyone seeking a distinguished dining experience and authentic Middle Eastern cuisine
The place is good, but I was there for almost 45 minutes for one sandwiches

I ordered a Shawarma sandwich and a Shawarma over rice platter. The Shawarma sandwich is supposed to be with everything  When I got home, I opened. It is so dry with only chicken the amount of chicken enough for two sandwiches, but itâ€™s so dry and salty. I couldnâ€™t eat it and also the Shawarma over rice. The vegetables is so soggy in the Shawarma. Itâ€™s so salty impossible to eat at the time when I was picking up my food three workers behind the counter with nasty gloves, touching everywhere With their mouth full of Kat Looks so nasty and embarrassing if I were the owner of this place, they would not stay to work another day. I live a hour away from that place and by the time Food, it was already too late The place was already close otherwise I wouldâ€™ve returned it back. This would be the last time for me to stop at that place.
If I could put a zero star I would,
Very Overpriced frood and definitely not up to the quality. Similar foods can be found other places almost half the price and with better quality.
Best experience ğŸ˜

I ordered a mixed grill platter for $27, taxes included, and I couldn't believe the amount of food! Everything was fresh, flavorful, and really satisfying. The restaurant environment is also nice, spacious and cozy if you're dining in. Highly recommended! Thanks so much shawarma mocci!!
Very pricey for the community, plus the food is not that good !

Menu is Overpriced with not enough of details, I find it very expensive for a basic  chicken shawarma wrap 16$ plus tax with no fries, plus the quality itâ€™s not even worth the price menu, our community does not deserve this!!

MashAllah wow

This place is amazing!!! I had the mix shawarma and It was amazing and tasty and it came in a box with fries dipping sauce and was 14 bucks

Iâ€™m reading comments and people are complaining like a frozen Big Mac costs the same and this was fresh and high quality food.

Also I had an order of Kibbeh and kebab Sanaa style.

Place is clean and huge and food is fresh and the staff are lovely, they gave me a lentil soup to taste that was awesome and tea to go for free!!!

Bronx is lucky to have this kind of place
good food & delicious

Terrible service, food was taking an excessive amount of time to prepare, person taking orders didn't speak english even though there were plenty of guys there that spoke english.

Didn't even bother eat, left after they started using power tools in the restaurant resulting in really loud, annoying noise. Why would they do this during business hours????
The best showarma in ny
I use to eat the showeram everyday from there  why is sill bad now ğŸ˜ ya hurt my feelingsâ€¦
This place is a must try, we decided to try most of their food, never disappointed, the staff were super friendly and went beyond expectations to make this experience amazing.
They have a very expensive arugula salad on the menu. When you order arugula salad, they bring you lettuce, red pepper, and tomato slices?? Why do they do this, I wonder?
Great food. The grilled chicken was out of this world.
Ù…Ù…ÙŠØ²
Amazing food

Guy just puts on random sauces on without asking.

Put BBQ sauce on my platter without asking. Ruined the whole thing. If you like BBQ, thatâ€™s fine, I donâ€™t.

They get 2 stars

Yo, if youâ€™re looking for the best shawarma and platters, this is the spot! The chicken and beef kabobs were fireâ€”perfectly cooked, seasoned just right, and the portions were crazy generous. They even hooked me up with a free appetizer, which was super cool of them. The staff is mad friendly, and the prices wonâ€™t hurt your wallet. Donâ€™t sleep on this placeâ€”itâ€™s a hidden gem for real!
Amazing food and very nice customer service!

Good experience coming here to order today. Walked in from a cold winter morning and was immediately greeted with a sample size cup of hot lentil soup to warm me up. Surprising to see such generosity in the Bronx. Shawarma sandwich plate with fries was delicious. Would definitely recommend.

Bought meat shawarma sandwich today. The menu says it comes with tahini,tomato,and pickles!!
Look at the photo! Nothing but dry hard meat.â€¦

Ordered 2 chicken Shawarmas with everything (lettuce, tomato, pickles...etc). When I brought it home and took a bite into it, the sandwich was completely dry. Chicken was overcooked completely bone dry. The sandwich only had chicken, very little bit of sauce and some fries. It was missing all the other ingredients. Complete disappointment. On top of that I ordered hummus and asked if it comes with bread and was only given one small round piece of bread. Not enough for the tub of hummus that I ordered. I doubt I'll be ordering again from here.
Amazing atmosphere , great service and delicious food , will deff be a regular !

We recently ordered a shawarma platter for takeout for the first time. While the portion size is generous, the price feels quite high. The sandwich itself was slightly dry, and the chicken seasoning wasnâ€™t the typical flavor weâ€™re accustomed to in shawarma. On a positive note, the dip sauce was tasty, but the portion was too small. I recommend revisiting the chicken seasoning, adjusting the pricing, and increasing the dip portion size.

Shawarma mocci is a good place, but needs to make some real changes if it wants to sustain itself.

First off the pricing. It is very expensive compared to its local counterparts. Shawarma platter starts minimum $20. Thatâ€™s quite expensive, especially if you compare to places that have built the reputation in cities like Queens.

Secondly, being mindful of their menu items and portions. Their menu states that platters should get hummus pickles and fries. Yet 90% of the time that I have ordered, they missed the fries. The portions of the meat is also significantly small. if I am paying $20 for a platter, I am fully expecting everything to be included and that the portion size of the meat match the cost.

In terms of flavor, this place is good. Others may have complained about the meat too dry, but I have not experienced that.

Overall, this is a decent place with lots of potential . I truly believe if they reduce the price by a couple of dollars they will not only see more people coming through the door. They should also make sure that the employees understand whatâ€™s on the menu. If something says fries is included then they should definitely be including it, especially if theyâ€™re going to charge so much money.

The food was really good.  I had the chicken Arabic sandwich, very delicious.  Came with fries which was seasoned, coleslaw and pickled carrots.  Staff was very welcoming from the time I walked in.  Will be ordering again.

The food is pretty good at this location but the service is horrible. This is my second day ordering from here and they messed up my order I asked for lamb shish kebab and they give me kofta kebab. Yesterday I asked for 3 chicken shawarma and they only gave me 2 while I paided for 3 orders of chicken shawarma. To the owner of this establishment please teach your employees how to speak English, listen to orders properly, and accommodate your customers the proper way

Ordered 1 chicken shawarma combo on the phone, was told 10 minutes so I came after abt 15 minutes.
Even after 15 mins I had to wait in the restaurant for another 20 minutes to get my food.
When it was finally ready, the order was for 2 shawarmas despite only ordering 1 on the phone.
There shawarma taste exactly like what you would get from Paterson NJ, only difference is this place takes nearly an hour to get a simple shawarma ready.
The employees are so nice. I ordered a wrap and they let me add what I wanted and made great portions. Also I love their hummus and shawarmas.

Order chicken shawarma and fries. The chicken shawarma was too dry and didnâ€™t have no garlic sauce or fries just chicken. The fries were good but need to be seasoned. Hopefully they improve , cuz i want to be a regular customer. Congrats
It was two half chickens and fish. Food was great
Staff and owners are really nice. They should work on the food quality because itâ€™s not the best. The menu is overpriced.
The best shawarma in the city, it tastes very delicious and the service is fast. I will definitely come back every day.
Had the mixed grill, it was tender and juicy. Opened new so, Friendly staff. Lol . ğŸ¤they keep up the good service.

I was waiting for this for long time to have a shawarma place like this in The Bronx, owner you the best, you saved me a lot and your place is so cozy and super clean I highly recommend to everyone to go there,thanks guys for the good work

The food amazing
service
, very good storage is beautiful. Thank you guys. You have to go there. The food.
Too expensive for the tiny portions. Mix grill platter had only 2 tiny pieces of each meat and mostly rice.
Beautiful place, comfortable chairs. Nice lightening. Quiet environment. Good service. Freshly made food.
Small place but clean. Food is good and desserts are delicious. Worth a try.
Honestly, the food is very delicious and the place is wonderful. I advise many to go and try it.
Finally, a shawarma place in the Bronx! Authentic food with great service and good prices.
I recommend it, I ordered food for myself and my family and the food was very delicious. I highly recommend it
Amazing
